info.description: Amazon WorkLink is a cloud-based service that provides secure access to internal websites and web apps from iOS phones. In a single step, your users, such as employees, can access internal websites as efficiently as they access any other public website. They enter a URL in their web browser, or choose a link to an internal website in an email. Amazon WorkLink authenticates the user's access and securely renders authorized internal web content in a secure rendering service in the AWS cloud. Amazon WorkLink doesn't download or store any internal web content on mobile devices.
info.title: Amazon WorkLink

post.description: Updates fleet metadata, such as DisplayName.

DisplayName.description: The fleet name to display. The existing DisplayName is unset if null is passed.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.description: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

post.description: Imports the root certificate of a certificate authority (CA) used to obtain TLS certificates used by associated websites within the company network.

WebsiteCaId.description: A unique identifier for the CA.

Certificate.description: The root certificate of the CA.

post.description: Creates a fleet. A fleet consists of resources and the configuration that delivers associated websites to authorized users who download and set up the Amazon WorkLink app.

FleetName.description: A unique name for the fleet.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.description: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

post.description: Deletes a fleet. Prevents users from accessing previously associated websites.
Describes the configuration for delivering audit streams to the customer account.

AuditStreamArn.description: The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis data stream that will receive the audit events.

post.description: Describes the networking configuration to access the internal websites associated with the specified fleet.

SecurityGroupIds.description: The security groups associated with access to the provided subnets.

SubnetIds.description: The subnets used for X-ENI connections from Amazon WorkLink rendering containers.

VpcId.description: The VPC with connectivity to associated websites.

post.description: Provides information about a user's device.

FirstAccessedTime.description: The date that the device first signed in to Amazon WorkLink.

LastAccessedTime.description: The date that the device last accessed Amazon WorkLink.

OperatingSystem.description: The operating system of the device.

OperatingSystemVersion.description: The operating system version of the device.

PatchLevel.description: The operating system patch level of the device.

Status.description: The current state of the device.

Username.description: The user name associated with the device.

DeviceId.description: A unique identifier for a registered user's device.

post.description: Describes the device policy configuration for the specified fleet.

DeviceCaCertificate.description: The certificate chain, including intermediate certificates and the root certificate authority certificate used to issue device certificates.

post.description: Provides basic information for the specified fleet, excluding identity provider, networking, and device configuration details.

CompanyCode.description: The identifier used by users to sign in to the Amazon WorkLink app.

CreatedTime.description: The time that the fleet was created.

FleetStatus.description: The current state of the fleet.

LastUpdatedTime.description: The time that the fleet was last updated.

OptimizeForEndUserLocation.description: The option to optimize for better performance by routing traffic through the closest AWS Region to users, which may be outside of your home Region.

post.description: Describes the identity provider configuration of the specified fleet.

IdentityProviderSamlMetadata.description: The SAML metadata document provided by the users identity provider.

ServiceProviderSamlMetadata.description: The SAML metadata document uploaded to the users identity provider.

post.description: Provides information about the certificate authority.

Certificate.description: The root certificate of the certificate authority.

CreatedTime.description: The time that the certificate authority was added.

WebsiteCaId.description: A unique identifier for the certificate authority.

post.description: Removes a certificate authority (CA).

WebsiteCaId.description: A unique identifier for the CA.

post.description: Retrieves a list of devices registered with the specified fleet.

NextToken.description: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to be included in the next page.

NextToken.description: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

post.description: Retrieves a list of fleets for the current account and Region.

FleetSummaryList.description: The summary list of the fleets.

CompanyCode.description: The identifier used by users to sign into the Amazon WorkLink app.

CreatedTime.description: The time when the fleet was created.

LastUpdatedTime.description: The time when the fleet was last updated.

NextToken.description: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to be included in the next page.

NextToken.description: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

post.description: Retrieves a list of certificate authorities added for the current account and Region.

NextToken.description: The pagination token used to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

post.description: Signs the user out from all of their devices. The user can sign in again if they have valid credentials.
Updates the audit stream configuration for the fleet.

AuditStreamArn.description: The ARN of the Amazon Kinesis data stream that receives the audit events.
